Interface BufferDouble

All Known Implementing Classes:
CircularBufferDouble
public interface BufferDouble
Buffer interface specifies methods called by Master and Slave
Version:
1.0, 30 November 2021
Author:
Ben DeSollar

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    double[] blockingGet()
    gets a double array containing the 3 values for the root finder
    void blockingPut​(double[] array)
    // place double array into Buffer
    boolean getFinishedState()
    checks whether the slaves are done calculating the roots or not
    int getNumberCalculated()
    gets the number of sets of roots calculated
    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> getNumberOfCalculationsEachThreadDid()
    gets a hashmap with the key as the thread number and the value as the number of roots that thread calculated
    int getNumberOfSetsToCalculate()
    gets the number of sets the user asks to calculate the roots for
    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Double> getTimeTakenToCalculateByEachThread()
    gets a hashmap with the key as the thread number and the value as the time it too to calculate all the roots
    void setFinishedState​(boolean finishedState)
    sets whether the slaves are done calculating the roots or not
    void setNumberCalculated​(int numberCalculated)
    sets the number of sets of roots calculated
    void setNumberOfSetsToCalculate​(int num)
    sets the number of sets the user asks to calculate the roots for

  • Method Details

    • blockingPut

      void blockingPut​(double[] array) throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      // place double array into Buffer
      Parameters:
      array - array containing the 3 values for the root finder
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - exception occurs if the thread has been interrupted

    • blockingGet

      double[] blockingGet() throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      gets a double array containing the 3 values for the root finder
      Returns:
      a double array containing the 3 values for the root finder
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - exception occurs if the thread has been interrupted

    • getNumberOfSetsToCalculate

      int getNumberOfSetsToCalculate()
      gets the number of sets the user asks to calculate the roots for
      Returns:
      the number of sets the user asks to calculate the roots for

    • setNumberOfSetsToCalculate

      void setNumberOfSetsToCalculate​(int num)
      sets the number of sets the user asks to calculate the roots for
      Parameters:
      num - the number of sets the user asks to calculate the roots for

    • getFinishedState

      boolean getFinishedState()
      checks whether the slaves are done calculating the roots or not
      Returns:
      true or false depending on if the slaves are done calculating the roots

    • setFinishedState

      void setFinishedState​(boolean finishedState)
      sets whether the slaves are done calculating the roots or not
      Parameters:
      finishedState - true or false depending on if the slaves are done calculating the roots

    • getNumberOfCalculationsEachThreadDid

      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> getNumberOfCalculationsEachThreadDid()
      gets a hashmap with the key as the thread number and the value as the number of roots that thread calculated
      Returns:
      a hashmap with the key as the thread number and the value as the number of roots that thread calculated

    • getTimeTakenToCalculateByEachThread

      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Double> getTimeTakenToCalculateByEachThread()
      gets a hashmap with the key as the thread number and the value as the time it too to calculate all the roots
      Returns:
      a hashmap with the key as the thread number and the value as the time it too to calculate all the roots
